title: David Lee Roth
summary: David Lee Roth (born October 10, 1954)[1] is an American rock musician, singer, songwriter and former radio personality.[2] Best known for his wild, energetic stage persona, he was the lead singer of the hard rock band Van Halen across three stints, from 1974 to 1985, in 1996 and again from 2006 to their disbandment in 2020.[3] He was also known as a successful solo artist, releasing numerous RIAA-certified Gold and Platinum albums.[4] After more than two decades apart, Roth re-joined Van Halen in 2006 for a North American tour that became the highest-grossing in the band's history[5] and one of the highest-grossing of that year.[6] In 2012, Roth and Van Halen released the comeback album A Different Kind of Truth. In 2007, he was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame as a member of Van Halen.
